p: Since ancient times, essential oils have been used due to their effects on humans and animals. They have been widely used for antibacterial, antiviral, fungicidal, insecticidal, acaricidal, antiparasitical, antipyretic, expectorant, anticancer, and cytotoxic activities [ 25, 33, 34, 61, 62, 63]. EOs have been studied for their ability to suppress the synthesis of mycotoxins, including aflatoxin [ 64].
